intro: Saccolabium rheedei, commonly known as the yellow lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Saccolabium rheedei is relatively drought-tolerant once established, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
